is there a proper channel to get help wi: Im trying to get cups running, I did it a few weeks ago before i was forced to reinstall. The first time, in the end, all I needed to do was to change the listening port from loclhost to * then I ran a single cups command that enabled network printing. For the life of me I can't find that command again. Any one have any ideas?
cups can easily be handeled in Ubuntu Gui
on the host PC (PC with printer to be shared) go into printing from System > Admin > Printing
You should see a window that says Printer Configuration - Local Host
Click Server > SettingsThen Check (Show Printers, Publish Shared Printers, Allow Printing from the Internet, Allow Remote Admin then hit ok
Also make sure under Server > connect you have (Without Quotes "/var/run/cups/cups.sock"
then on the Pc's to be hooked up check mark Server > Setting > (Show Printers Shared By other Systems, Allow Printing From Internet)
Then your other pcs should detect the printer on the same network automatically
No Problem, printing was my hardest step in learning ubuntu, but its actually quite simple
